source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a time-lapse video of a massive, ominous storm system moving over a rural landscape. The dark, turbulent clouds of what appears to be a supercell thunderstorm are seen progressing across the fields. The dramatic scene is illuminated by a sliver of light on the horizon beneath the dark storm front.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a time-lapse video of a massive, ominous storm system moving over a rural landscape. The dark, turbulent clouds of what appears to be a supercell thunderstorm are seen progressing across the fields. The dramatic scene is illuminated by a sliver of light on the horizon beneath the dark storm front.

generated_critique: The caption accurately identifies the subject as a time-lapse of a storm, but it relies on subjective adjectives like "massive," "ominous," and "dramatic," which the instructions advise against. It also uses the speculative phrase "what appears to be," violating the rule to avoid uncertainty. The description of motion is too generic; "progressing across the fields" fails to capture the specific dynamic movements visible in a time-lapse of a supercell. For instance, the video likely shows the entire cloud structure rotating, with lower cloud bands swirling into the main updraft. The caption also misses other key motion elements, such as curtains of rain or hail visibly sweeping across the landscape from one side to the other, or frequent flashes of lightning illuminating the turbulent cloud mass from within. A more effective description would focus entirely on these specific, observable actions in chronological order, detailing how the storm cloud rotates and how precipitation moves across the ground, rather than describing the static "sliver of light" or the general appearance of the scene.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: This time-lapse video captures a storm system moving over a rural landscape, showcasing the dynamic rotation of the supercell thunderstorm. The entire cloud structure rotates, with lower cloud bands swirling into the main updraft. Curtains of rain and hail sweep across the fields, while frequent flashes of lightning illuminate the turbulent cloud mass from within.
